description: Alerts when code complexity exceeds thresholds in real-time
author: JSONbored
features: Real-time complexity monitoring for JavaScript, TypeScript, and Python
Nesting level detection for code structure
Instant feedback on code maintainability issues

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Read the tool input from stdin
INPUT=$(cat)
TOOL_NAME=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_name')
FILE_PATH=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // .tool_input.path // ""')

if [ -z "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
  exit 0
fi

# Check if it's a supported file type
if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.js ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.jsx ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.ts ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.tsx ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.py ]]; then
  echo "ðŸ” Analyzing code complexity for $FILE_PATH..." >&2
  
  # Check file exists
  if [ ! -f "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
    echo "ðŸ“ File does not exist yet, skipping complexity analysis" >&2
    exit 0
  fi
  
  # Line count analysis
  LINES=$(wc -l < "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
  if [ "$LINES" -gt 500 ]; then
    echo "âš ï¸ COMPLEXITY: File exceeds 500 lines ($LINES lines) - consider splitting into smaller modules" >&2
  elif [ "$LINES" -gt 300 ]; then
    echo "ðŸ“Š INFO: File is getting large ($LINES lines) - monitor for complexity" >&2
  fi
  
  # Function/method count analysis
  FUNCTION_COUNT=$(grep -E '(function|def |const.*=>|class |async |export function)' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null | wc -l || echo "0")
  if [ "$FUNCTION_COUNT" -gt 20 ]; then
    echo "âš ï¸ COMPLEXITY: Too many functions/methods ($FUNCTION_COUNT) - consider modularization" >&2
  elif [ "$FUNCTION_COUNT" -gt 15 ]; then
    echo "ðŸ“Š INFO: High function count ($FUNCTION_COUNT) - good candidate for refactoring" >&2
  fi
  
  # Nesting level analysis (rough estimate)
  OPEN_BRACES=$(grep -o '{' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null | wc -l || echo "0")
  CLOSE_BRACES=$(grep -o '}' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null | wc -l || echo "0")
  
  if [ "$OPEN_BRACES" -gt 50 ]; then
    echo "âš ï¸ COMPLEXITY: High nesting detected ($OPEN_BRACES braces) - consider flattening logic" >&2
  fi
  
  # Python-specific checks
  if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.py ]]; then
    INDENT_DEPTH=$(grep -E '^[ ]{12,}' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null | wc -l || echo "0")
    if [ "$INDENT_DEPTH" -gt 5 ]; then
      echo "âš ï¸ COMPLEXITY: Deep indentation detected in Python code - consider function extraction" >&2
    fi
  fi
  
  echo "âœ… Complexity analysis completed for $FILE_PATH" >&2
else
  echo "File $FILE_PATH is not a supported type for complexity analysis" >&2
fi

exit 0

useCases: Real-time code quality monitoring during development
Automated complexity alerts in CI/CD pipelines
Code review assistance and maintainability checks
Technical debt prevention and early detection

troubleshooting.issue: Notification hook not running on file write operations
troubleshooting.solution: Verify hook is registered under hooks.notification in .claude/config.json. Check script has executable permissions. Ensure jq is installed for JSON parsing from stdin input.

troubleshooting.issue: Complexity alerts not showing for TypeScript files
troubleshooting.solution: Check file extension matches supported types: .js, .jsx, .ts, .tsx, .py. Verify FILE_PATH extraction from tool_input using jq processes correctly. Test with echo command to debug input parsing.

troubleshooting.issue: False positives for brace count in JSX files
troubleshooting.solution: Hook counts all braces including JSX elements. Adjust thresholds in script for JSX-heavy files. Consider implementing AST-based complexity analysis instead of regex pattern matching.

troubleshooting.issue: File does not exist error during notification processing
troubleshooting.solution: Hook runs after tool execution but file may not be written yet. Add delay with sleep 1 before analysis. Check tool_name matches write or edit operations. Verify path resolution is absolute.

troubleshooting.issue: Python indentation warnings incorrect for valid code
troubleshooting.solution: Hook detects 12+ space indentation as deep nesting. Adjust threshold for projects using different indent styles. Use grep -E pattern to match your preferred indentation depth level.
